mods.abstract: Temple of Hathor at Abu Simbel (New Kingdom Dynasty XIX); Temple of Hathor and Nefretari built ca. 100 meters northeast of The Great Temple supported by massive statues of Rameses II wearing the hedjet (left) and sekhemty (right) flanked by Nefretari as Hathor wearing the hesat crown, rock in between and above statues inscribed with hieroglyphs and cartouches indentifying Rameses II; "A. Beato" in black at bottom left center of print; untitled print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
